intro: Ditaxis serrata, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stem and milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have serrated edges, giving it its scientific name. The flowers are small and clustered, usually in umbels, and can be white, yellow, or greenish in color.
